item.title: Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPV 6)
item.description: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) is the most recent version of the Internet Protocol (Ip) IPv6 extends address size to 128 bits

item.title: IP Address
item.description: IP address is 32 bit address IP address are unique IP stands for internet protocol and is basically an address that the packets will be sent to

item.title: Parts of An IP Address
item.description: Â [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/parts_of_an_IP_address_in_detail|Network ]] - A unique number that is assigned to your network [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/parts_of_an_IP_address_in_detail|Hosts]] - This is a unique address which assigned to each host in the network - It uniquely identifies these machines in the network

item.title: Parts of An IP Address in Detail
item.description: A Subnet mask is a 32-bit number that masks an IP address. Also divides the IP address into network address and host address.

item.title: Types of IP Address
item.description: There are 5 types of IP address A - 1.0.0.0 to 127.255.255.255 B - 128.
